author: gregthegreek
content:
I don't think the `latest` docker tag of Geth is conforming to `eth_estimateGas` correctly. I saw on the latest release that IFF you do not supply `gasLimit` it will default to `1559` but that doesn't seem to be the case, since the following payload is returning a 1559 error:
```
# payload - note this is from web3.js internals, this payload is being sent to "eth_estimateGas"
 {
    from: '0x91a37bea41dc245b81b8b85bbdc6729474a6fc2c',
    data: '0x[...]',
    gasPrice: '0x1',
    gas: '0x3d0900'
  }

# response
max fee per gas less than block base fee: address 0x29ecd97a9cd857De3AE434B4f71e54cbb2340866, maxFeePerGas: 1 baseFee: 670622133 (supplied gas 2010499)
```
From my understanding this should not return an EVM error but instead numerical value (in hex).

author: gregthegreek
content: <@543900561460822016> may have explained this to me better. I guess instead I need to set the gasPrice to the base fee?

author: lightclient
content: IUC, if you explicitly provide the `gasPrice` it needs to be greater than the `baseFeePerGas` of the current (last?) block, otherwise the tx is invalid
